intro: Pimpinella favifolia, commonly known as the yellow cowpea, is a flowering plant native to tropical and subtropical regions. It belongs to the Apiaceae family, which includes carrots and parsley, and is characterized by its aromatic leaves and small yellow flowers. The plant typically grows to a height of 1 to 2 meters, with compound leaves and clusters of white or yellow flowers. Its seeds are often used in traditional medicine and as a food source in various parts of Asia and Africa. The plant thrives in well-drained soil and requires full sun to partial shade for optimal growth.
